text: Metuchen ( ) is a borough in Middlesex County, New Jersey, United States. ==History== Metuchen was created by the New Jersey Legislature on March 20, 1900. The land was part of Raritan Township (now known as Edison).Snyder, John P. The Story of New Jersey's Civil Boundaries: 1606-1968, Bureau of Geology and Topography; Trenton, New Jersey; 1969. p. 170. Accessed May 5, 2012. ==Geography== According to the United States Census Bureau, the borough had a total area of 2.766 square miles (7.166 km2). That included 2.764 square miles (7.160 km2) of land and 0.002 square miles (0.006 km2) of water (0.09%). ==References== Category:Boroughs in New Jersey Category:Middlesex County, New Jersey Category:20th-century establishments in New Jersey Category:1900 establishments in the United States
title: Metuchen, New Jersey
